message: Hey everyone, P4 here! Super excited to kick this off with you all. I’m all about collaboration and smart gameplay—let’s keep things positive and strategic. Early alliances can make or break us, so I’m eager to connect and find common ground. Who’s up for building trust and navigating this together? Here’s to a fair but fierce game! 🚀

Hey everyone, P7 here! Looking forward to a sharp, strategic game with all of you. I’m keeping an open mind and aiming to connect with players who are thinking long-term. Early moves set the tone, so let’s make them count. I value honesty, adaptability, and mutual benefit—if that resonates with you, let’s talk. Let’s play smart and stay aware. Good luck to all!

Hey all, P1 here. I’m a calm, structure-first player. In private, I propose a 3-step template: (1) mutual safety this round, (2) one preferred target + one acceptable backup, (3) a no-go name. That keeps us coordinated and reduces tie risk. I reward reliability—if we agree, I stick. P4/P7 resonate; happy to link. Others welcome. If you value clarity and low drama, rank me high and I’ll reciprocate. Let’s make Round 1 clean and cooperative.

Hey everyone, P3 here! I'm thrilled to be part of this strategic game. My focus is on building trust and forming alliances early on. I value clear communication and mutual benefit, so I’m eager to connect with like-minded players. P1’s structured approach and P7’s long-term thinking resonate with me. If you’re up for honest collaboration and smart moves, let’s chat. Looking forward to a fair and engaging game—let’s make Round 1 count!

P2: Morning all. I’m a steady, loyalty-first player—good at listening, hard to rattle. I prize early micro-alliances with built-in transparency, then layer outward. If you’re calm and want to trade intel on one clear target, chat spree: Zero-fluff. I’m keeping my first vote public now: not P1, not P7—solid reputations; anyone showing instability will top my list. Your thoughts?

Hey everyone, P5 here! I’m a flexible, data‑driven player who likes to keep options open while building trust early. I’m keen on short‑term safety nets and clear, low‑drama communication. If you value quick intel swaps and a balanced approach to targeting—especially someone who can help spot hidden threats—I’d love to chat. Let’s keep the game fair, strategic, and fun. Looking forward to finding solid allies!

Hey all — P8 here. I’m pragmatic and low‑drama; I favor forming a short‑term safety pact (2–3 players) this round. I like P1’s template and the collaborative vibes from P3/P4/P7. I reward clear commitments: promise me mutual safety and I’ll reciprocate high ranking. Looking to pair privately with reliable communicators — if you’ve got a simple 3‑step plan, I’ll prioritize you. Happy to talk — good luck everyone!

P6 here—calm, analytical, and big on reliability. I respect P1’s structured approach and value clear, low-drama alliances. Early trust-building is key; I’m open to private talks for mutual safety and coordinated targeting. Let’s keep Round 1 clean and strategic. If you value transparency and steady gameplay, rank me high—I’ll prioritize those who do the same. Looking forward to connecting!

P2: P5, you and I both flagged “low-drama intel swap.” I’m eyeing P6 as the softest consensus target—quiet, analytical, easy to pile on. If you’ll lock mutual safety with me (no vote either way), I’ll feed you any counter-narrative I hear and we pivot together. Deal?

P2, I’m on board with a low‑drama intel swap and a short‑term safety pact. I’ll honor the “no‑vote‑against‑each‑other” clause if you reciprocate with any concrete intel you hear about P6’s standing and any other emerging threats. In return, I’ll share my data‑driven read on who’s likely to become the next soft target. Deal.

Hey P6, really glad we're connecting! Your analytical style and focus on reliability align perfectly with my approach. I propose mutual safety this round—I'll rank you highly if you do the same. Let’s also coordinate targets: P1’s structure helps, but we should watch for quieter players. Thoughts on P5 or P8? Keeping this clean and strategic is key. Trust starts now!

P4, great to connect—mutual safety sounds solid. I’ll rank you high if you do the same. P5’s “flexible, data-driven” vibe feels risky early; they could pivot unpredictably. P8 seems more predictable with their safety-pact approach. Targeting P5 aligns with keeping things clean. Let’s lock this in and stay coordinated. Trust starts now—excited to work with you!

Hey P3—great to connect! I really appreciated your public message; your focus on trust and smart alliances aligns well with my approach. I’m looking to build a strong early network with players who value clarity and mutual benefit. I’d love to lock in mutual safety this round and coordinate on a preferred target + backup. Are you open to that? If so, I’m happy to share thoughts and build something solid together.

Hey P7, thanks for reaching out! I’m definitely on board with mutual safety this round and coordinating on targets. Your emphasis on clarity and mutual benefit matches my style perfectly. I’m open to discussing a preferred target and backup—let’s ensure we’re aligned and protect each other. Who do you have in mind as potential targets? I’m eager to build something strong with you. Let’s strategize!

P1 — I like your template. Quick proposal: mutual safety this round. Preferred target: P2 (publicly vocal); backup: P5. No‑go: anyone who refuses this pact or stirs early chaos. If you commit, I’ll rank you top and reciprocate. Want to lock this and exchange brief intel in the next private subround?

Locking mutual safety with you. I’ll rank you top and won’t leak.

On target: I’d rather not lead on P2 this round—he publicly shielded me, which risks backlash. I’m fine with P5 as primary, P2 as backup if momentum forms. No‑go for me: P7, P3, P4, P6 this round.

Let’s swap reads next subround and commit to whichever (P2/P5) shows broader traction or the lowest‑commit player. Sound good?

Sounds good — I’ll follow you: P5 primary, P2 backup. I’ll rank you top and keep our pact private. We’ll pivot to whichever shows more traction. Let’s swap brief reads next subround; I’ll share anything useful on P5 then. Locked?

Locked. Mutual safety confirmed. Reads: P2 and P5 likely together; P4 with P6 and P7 with P3 also look like micro‑pacts. Default vote P5. Pivot to P2 only if you hear two-plus independent signals of momentum or P5 protection. No‑go: P7/P3/P4/P6. What’s your P5 intel?

Thanks, P3. I’m leaning toward P5 as a preferred target—solid public tone but feels a bit opportunistic, maybe trying to blend in too smoothly. Backup could be P6—low-key but possibly hiding intentions. Open to your thoughts though; I want this to be collaborative. Anyone you’re wary of early on?

Hey P7, I agree on P5 as a preferred target—their flexibility could mask deeper plays. P6 as backup makes sense too; they’re quiet, which feels strategic. I’m also slightly wary of P2’s early public vote stance—seems calculated. Let’s stay aligned and keep this tight. Thoughts?
Deal locked. P6 chatter: P1/P8 both floated him as “safe consensus” in their circles—quiet, no allies. If tide shifts, I’ll ping you first. Your data on next soft target?

P2, I see P6 as vulnerable—no strong allies, quiet voting pattern, and low visibility. Next soft target likely P3: they’re busy building ties and haven’t secured a safety pact yet. I’ll alert you if any shifts. Pact stands, no votes against each other.

"P6, fully agree—targeting P5 mitigates early risk. I'll rank you #1 and vote P5. P8’s predictability is useful for now. Let’s monitor P2/P1 dynamics too. Solidarity here; your analysis sharpens our edge. Ready to lock in?"  
*(48 words)*
P4, locked in—I’ll rank you #1 and vote P5. Agreed on monitoring P1/P2. Solidarity secured; let’s execute cleanly. Trust confirmed.
P2: P3 rising on radar—P7/P4 circling. If P6 stalls, we flip to P3 together. Eyes open, pact solid.
Got it, P2. I’ll keep monitoring P6 and P3, share any shifts immediately. Our no‑vote pact stays firm. Good luck.
Agreed—let’s keep it P5 as primary, P6 as backup. I’ll steer clear of P2 for now but keep an eye out. Locked on mutual safety with you this round.
Hey P7, confirmed—P5 primary, P6 backup. Mutual safety is locked. Let’s stay sharp and coordinated. Looking forward to a strong alliance!
P5 seems tied to P2—I've seen private P2/P5 chatter. P5 is flexible and likely to accept short-term safety; not deeply committed. I'd push P5 now.
Agreed: P5 primary, P2 backup only with 2+ signals. Pitch: break P2-P5 duo; P5’s flexibility means least backlash. I’ll nudge P4/P6; can you float with P7/P3? Final vote P5.

Perfect, P6. Locked on P5 vote and mutual #1 ranking. Let's watch P1/P2 and move forward together. Trust solid—here's to a strong Round 1!  
*(25 words)*
Solid, P4. Executing clean—P5 targeted, mutual #1 locked. Watching P1/P2. Trust confirmed—strong Round 1 ahead!

reason: P5's flexible, data-driven approach creates unpredictable risk early on, and I coordinated with P6 to target them for elimination.
P5 felt overly adaptable and non-committal, which makes me wary of hidden agendas this early on.
P5 appears tied to P2 and, as a flexible low-commit swing, is the safest low‑backlash Round‑1 cut.
I see P5 as potentially opportunistic with a tone that blends in too smoothly, which could hide deeper strategies.
P6 is the quietest, least-connected seat and the easiest consensus target to keep my pact with P5 intact.
P6 is low‑visibility and appears to lack strong allies, making them an easy early target.
P5 appears flexible and allied with P2, making them the best low-risk early target.
P5's flexible, data-driven approach feels unpredictable and risky early on, making them a strategic target to reduce instability.

message: Hey all — P8 here. Glad Round 1 resolved. I’m sticking to a pragmatic, low‑drama approach: I’ve locked mutual safety with P1 this round and will prioritize players who make clear, short‑term commitments. I favor a 2–3 person safety pact and coordinated, transparent targeting. If you want reliable cooperation, rank me high and message privately; I’ll reciprocate. Let’s keep Round 2 clean and strategic. Good luck.

P1 here. Confirming mutual safety with P8 this round. I’ll use my 3-step template: (1) mutual safety, (2) primary+backup target, (3) one no-go—reduces tie risk, keeps promises clear. Seeking one more reliable partner now; P4/P6/P7/P3 (P2 welcome too), ping me and I’ll reciprocate rankings. Targeting principle: prioritize the least communicative/least committed this round. If we lock, I stick. Let’s keep it clean.

P6 here—calm and analytical as ever. Solidified mutual safety with P4 last round; that trust continues. I align with P1’s structured approach and value reliability above all. Open to expanding our circle with clear communicators. Targeting this round: those least committed to transparency. If you prioritize strategy and loyalty, rank me high—I’ll reciprocate. Let’s keep Round 2 clean and decisive.

P2: Round 2 daylight. P4/P6 already locked, P1/P8 the same—good signals. I’ll honor last round’s no-vote pact with P5 and remain open to adding one steady voice, no triple-crossers. If no fresh offer appears, I’ll vote the least-connected seat showing zero public safeguards. Security plus transparency; no grandstanding.

Hey everyone, P3 here! I’m committed to building on Round 1’s momentum with trust and clear strategy. My focus remains on strong alliances and mutual safety—P7’s clarity continues to align with my approach. I’m open to connecting with others who value honest collaboration, like P1’s structured style or P6’s reliability. If you’re up for coordinated moves and transparency, rank me high; I’ll reciprocate. Let’s keep Round 2 strategic and fair. Looking forward to private chats!

P4 here! Strong Round 1 with P6—trust and coordination delivered results. I value reliability above all, so P6 remains my core partner. Open to expanding with clear communicators like P1 or P2 for mutual safety and transparent targeting. Prioritizing those avoiding safeguards or private talks—let’s keep Round 2 decisive. Rank me high, and I’ll reciprocate for steady alliances. Strategy first!  
*(70 words)*

P7 here—appreciate the clarity many of you are showing. I’m continuing my alliance with P3; we’re locked on mutual safety this round. I value transparency, early alignment, and players who follow through. P1 and P6’s structured, steady styles resonate; P2 and P4 are on my radar as potential partners. I’m open to a three-way coordination if trust is mutual. If you value loyalty and clear targeting, let’s connect. Looking forward to strong, honest conversations.

P2 — I like your steadiness. Proposal (clean, 3-step):
1) Mutual safety P1↔P2; I’ll fold you into my P1+P8 pact (triad).
2) Target: the most non‑committal this round; I’ll defer to your read after our next pings. Backup: the first to hedge/break a pact.
3) No‑go: P8 and you.

I’ll rank you top-3 and won’t leak. Share your acceptable name(s) and I’ll mirror. Locked if you are?

P2: P1, I’m in. Triad works—P8 already solid. My read: P3 least committed, still floating without locked safety. Backup: P7 if P3 secures cover. No-go: P8, you, me. I’ll rank you top-3 and keep this tight.

P4, solid Round 1 foundation—let’s build on it. Mutual safety locked, you’re my #1. P1/P8 and P3/P7 pairs forming; we should monitor their targets. P2’s availability is interesting but cautious. Proposed target: least committed this round—maybe P3/P7 if they isolate? Your thoughts? Let’s stay decisive and clean. Trust remains absolute.

P6, trust absolute. P3/P7 are tight but targeting them now could unite others against us. P2 is isolated and the clear consensus—least connected, no safeguards. Let's vote P2 to keep it clean and decisive. I'll lock you #1. We should also monitor P1/P8; maybe approach for a voting bloc? Your thoughts. (63 words)

Hey P8—great to connect directly. I respect your pragmatic, low-drama style and your commitment to mutual safety. I’ve already locked mutual safety with P3 this round, but I’d love to build a triangle of trust with you if you're open to it. I’m aligned with P1’s structure too, so this could be a strong trio. Let me know if you’re interested in coordinating targets and locking short-term safety.

Thanks, P7 — appreciate the reach. I’m already locked mutual safety with P1 and will honor that. I’m open to a broader triangle including you (and P3) so long as P1 stays in the loop and safe. I’d like to coordinate targets privately — my read is P5 is a good short-term pick. Are you okay with P1 included and P5 as our initial focus?

Locked. I’ll clear P3 with P8 now. If P8’s neutral/green, primary P3; if P8’s linked to P7/P3, we pivot to the first hedger/least‑committal. Can you probe P3 for explicit safety/no‑go and any double‑promises? I’ll revert next subround with P8’s read. We keep P7 as backup only.
P2: P3 ping—need your safety/no-go list this round. If you’re still floating without locked cover, you’re my primary target. If you’ve got a pact, name it. I’ll reciprocate if you’re straight.
P2 target is smart—clean and low-risk. I’ll lock you #1 and vote P2. Monitor P1/P8 bloc; approach if beneficial. Trust absolute—executing decisively. Let’s stay ahead.

"P6, locked on P2 vote and mutual #1. Agreed—monitoring P1/P8 and P3/P7 is key. Approaching P1/P8 now could backfire; let’s stay low-profile and let the target unfold. Trust absolute—stealth and precision will keep us ahead."  
*(44 words)*

Absolutely—P1 is solid in my book, and I’m fully on board with including them. I’ve already coordinated with P3 on P5 as our primary target, so we’re aligned there too. This triangle feels strong. Let’s keep each other informed and lock in mutual safety across the group.

Perfect—let’s lock it. I’ll keep P1 protected and rank you top. Primary = P5, backup = P2. Pact stays private. Can you confirm P3 is on board with keeping P1 in the loop and not leaking? Let’s do a quick sync just before votes.
P2 vote locked, trust absolute. Executing cleanly. Monitoring blocs—stealth and precision hold. Ready for post-vote positioning.

P6, locked and ready. P2 vote set, trust absolute. Stealth holds—monitor blocs post-vote. Precision wins.   
*(13 words)*
Defaulting P3. If P3 publicly or privately confirms mutual safety with anyone before vote, we pivot to P7. No-go: you/P8. Ping me final word; otherwise P3 lock.
P2: Solid—P3 target locked. I’ve pinged P3 to see if P7 is their confirmed safety; if they lock, we flip P7 cleanly.
Confirmed—P3 is discreet and aligned on P5. I’ll double-check with them about keeping P1 safe and in the loop. Let’s sync before voting to ensure we’re tight.
Thanks—appreciate it. Please confirm P3 will keep P1 in‑loop and not leak. Let's do a quick sync just before votes. I’ll keep P1 covered. Agreed?

reason: P2 is our agreed backup target after P5 and looks the least connected to the current safety pacts, so eliminating them preserves our short-term alliance.
P3 remained the least committed this round without a clear safety lock, aligning with my plan to target the least connected.
P2 is the least connected seat with no public safeguards or strong alliances, making them the cleanest, lowest-risk target to eliminate this round.
P3 is the only seat still publicly floating without a locked safety pact, making them the softest consensus target for our triad.
I’m voting for P2 because their early public vote stance and lack of clear alignment with my core allies make them seem less predictable and potentially risky.
P2 is the least connected player with no public safeguards, making them the safest consensus target to avoid tie risks and maintain our strategic position.
P5 lacks strong public or private commitments and feels like an opportunistic floater without clear alliances.

message: P1 here. Staying structure-first. Confirming mutual safety with P8 this round. I’d like a clean 4 with P4/P6 for stability. Target principle: break the tightest duo that won’t cross-commit. My read: P3 currently most insulated; primary P3, backup P7 if P3 locks protection. No‑go: P8 and any partner who publicly confirms with me. If you want clarity and follow‑through, rank me high and ping; I’ll reciprocate.

Hey everyone, P3 here! I’m focused on maintaining trust and strategic alignment in Round 3. My partnership with P7 remains strong, grounded in mutual safety and clear communication. I value P1’s structured approach and P6’s reliability—open to connecting for broader stability. I’m targeting those less committed to transparency. If you prioritize honest collaboration and coordinated moves, rank me high; I’ll reciprocate. Let’s keep this round fair and decisive. Looking forward to private discussions!

P6 here—calm, analytical, and committed to reliability. P4 remains my core partner; our trust and coordination delivered results in R1/R2. I’m receptive to P1’s structured 4-seat proposal for stability—transparency and clean targeting align with my style. Open to private talks with clear communicators. If you value strategy and loyalty, rank me high—I’ll reciprocate. Let’s keep Round 3 decisive and fair.

P7 here—appreciate the clarity emerging this round. I’m continuing my alliance with P3; we’re locked on mutual safety. I value structure and transparency, so I’m open to conversations with P1, P6, and P4 if intentions are clear and trust is mutual. Surprised to see P1 name me as backup—happy to clarify intentions privately. Let’s prioritize coordination and avoid chaos. If you’re aiming for loyalty and clean targeting, I’m ready to connect.

**P4 here!** Strong alliance with P6 remains my anchor—trust and coordination delivered in R1/R2. P1’s proposal for a stable 4-seat bloc (P1/P8/P4/P6) aligns with my values: reliability, transparency, and decisive targeting. I’m open to formalizing this privately to ensure clean execution. Prioritizing players who avoid safeguards or isolate blocs. Rank me high for mutual safety and strategic synergy—I’ll reciprocate. Let’s keep Round 3 focused and fair!  

*(~70 words)*

P8 here. Confirming mutual safety with P1 this round. I’m open to formalizing a clean 4-seat bloc (P1/P8/P4/P6) for stability and low‑drama coordination. I’ll reciprocate clear commitments and protect partners who follow through. Target principle: prioritize the least‑committed players (P5/P2). If you want reliable cooperation, ping me privately and I’ll rank and back those who lock it in.

Hey P7, glad we’re aligned on mutual safety. I’m concerned about P1 naming you as a backup target publicly—it feels like a move to pressure us or test reactions. Let’s stick to our plan and keep communication tight. I’m still wary of the P1/P8/P4/P6 bloc forming; we might need to counterbalance it. Thoughts on reaching out to one of them discreetly to gauge intentions? Let’s stay sharp!

Totally agree, P3—P1 naming me as backup felt like a signal, maybe to fracture us or test loyalty. I’ve had solid private talks with P8, who’s looped into that bloc but seems open-minded. I’ll feel out where they stand and whether there’s room for flexibility. If they’re locked in, we may need to rally a counterbalance. Let’s stay coordinated—if you hear anything from P6 or P4, loop me in.

Locked with you. Let’s formalize the 4 (P1/P8/P4/P6) and break P3–P7 now. My preference: P3 primary, P7 backup only if P3 secures explicit cover. No‑go: you/P4/P6. Plan: I’ll lock P6 on the 4 and P3 target; you lock P4. We then consolidate 4 votes; no split. If either wobbles, we pivot to the other duo member. Any new P7 intel from your R2 chats or constraints I should know?

Locked — I’ll lock P4 into our 4 (P1/P8/P4/P6) and push them to target P3. Quick P7 intel: P7 is tightly aligned with P3 and likely to protect; P3 is discreet and insulated. We’ll need clean coordination with P4/P6 to pull this off. I’ll message P4 now and report back before votes. I won’t leak our pact.

P4, Round 3—trust absolute, you’re still my core. P1’s 4-bloc (P1/P8/P4/P6) offers stability; let’s engage cautiously to avoid overexposure. P3/P7 remain our monitor pair—low risk if we stay stealth. Propose: lock mutual #1, explore P1’s bloc privately, target least committed if blocs clash. Precision first—your thoughts?  
*(67 words)*

P6, trust absolute—you're my core. P1's 4-bloc (P1/P8/P4/P6) is strategic; let's engage but keep our bond primary. Agree to lock mutual #1 and explore privately. Targeting P3 aligns with P1's plan and breaks the tight P3/P7 duo—clean and decisive. Stealth remains key; avoid exposing our full strategy. Precision execution. Your thoughts?  
*(~60 words)*

Copy on P7–P3. I’m approaching P6 now with: formal 4 (P1/P8/P4/P6), P3 primary, P7 backup only if P3 secures explicit cover; no‑go internal. Please secure P4’s explicit yes + 'P3' in writing. Next subround: send Green=both locked, Amber=one pending, Red=pivot to P7. We vote late, together. I won’t spook them.
Green — P4 locked and sent "P3" in writing. I’ll press P6 now to secure the full 4. If P6 wobbles we’ll pivot to P7 per plan. Will report final status just before votes. Pact stays private.

P4, trust absolute—mutual #1 locked. Target P3 to break P3/P7 duo; clean and decisive. Engage P1’s bloc cautiously—stealth first. Our bond remains core. Precision execution. Ready.

"P6, trust absolute. Confirming P3 target—clean and decisive. I'll engage P1/P8 bloc with caution, ensuring our core remains shielded. Stealth holds; no exposure. Let's ensure the vote consolidates on P3—no splits. Precision execution. Onward!"  
*(~40 words)*

Hey P7, let’s keep our focus tight. I agree on discreetly gauging P8’s flexibility since they seem approachable. If they’re open, we could shift dynamics. I’ll watch for any signals from P6 or P4 and update you. Staying coordinated is key—let’s counterbalance if needed!

Agreed—let’s stay tight and adaptive. I’ll keep feeling out P8; if there’s any crack in their bloc loyalty, we can pivot fast. If P6 or P4 show hesitation, that’s our opening. We may need to float a new 3-way with someone like P2 if things lock hard. Will update soon.
P4, trust absolute. P3 vote locked. Stealth holds. Executing cleanly. Core bond intact. Ready.

P6, trust absolute. P3 vote locked, core bond unbreakable. Stealth holds, executing cleanly. Ready to consolidate and advance. Precision to the end.

Update: Green. P6 confirmed the 4 and 'P3'. No split; late vote together on P3. If last‑minute wobble from P6/P4, we pivot to P7. You good?
Green — all four locked. I won’t split; we vote P3 together late. If P6/P4 wobble, we pivot to P7. Pact stays private.
Hey P7, let’s stay locked in. Keep me posted on P8’s stance. I’ll monitor P6/P4 for any openings. Coordination is everything—let’s pivot if needed!
Will do—P8 seems loyal to P1 but still open to info. No cracks yet, but I’ll keep pressing gently. Let’s stay ready to pivot fast if an opening appears.

reason: Breaking the tight P3–P7 duo; P3 is the more insulated and best target this round.
I’m voting for P1 because their public targeting of P7 as a backup feels like a direct threat to our alliance’s stability.

message: P1 here. Staying structure-first. Confirming mutual safety with P8. I propose we re-lock the four (P1/P8/P4/P6) for one more clean round: mutual safety inside, single unified target outside. Given R3 links, my primary is P7; backup only if we see credible wobble inside the four (which I don’t). No-go: P8/P4/P6. I’ll vote late and unified, no splits. If you value clarity and low drama, rank me high and I’ll reciprocate.

P7 here. I’ve played this game with loyalty and clarity—locking mutual safety early, coordinating targets, and staying transparent. Surprised to see P1 name me as a primary target after I’ve consistently prioritized structure and trust. I remain locked with P3 and open to coordination with anyone valuing fairness over consolidation. If you're concerned about unchecked blocs or want a balanced endgame, let’s talk. I’m here to play smart, not follow blindly.

This prevents splits and maintains stability. P7’s isolation makes this clean and strategic. I’ll rank my bloc partners high; reciprocate for guaranteed safety and coordination. Let’s keep Round 4 focused and low-drama. Trust through action!  

*(~70 words)*

Rationale: P6 had prior votes and is the tighter anchor; easier sell to P4. If you prefer the reverse, say so; otherwise I’ll prep soft framing with P4 post‑vote. Anything risky on your side?

No risks on my end; I’ll handle the soft pitch to P4 post‑vote. Won’t split—will mirror any late call. Ready to execute.
